page.title: 18Interview with Policeman
page.content: Inspector Duff is the Police Inspector for the Dee Valley. He covers an area of 60 by 15 miles from the city boundaries of Aberdeen to Cairnwell near Glenshee. Inspector Duff was in the Military Police and after leaving the Army joined the Police Force in 1956. It took him twenty years to become an Inspector although nowadays it is easier to get promotion. He enjoys his work especially in Deeside although in the last ten years it has involved more paperwork. The biggest changes since he joined the Police have been the introduction of radios and computers. These enable a policeman to find out the owner of a vehicle in seconds.
